pli-tv-kd11:1.1.1.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One

pli-tv-kd11:1.1.2.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd11:1.1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd11:1.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū attanā bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā, yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.1.3.eng: At that time the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They went to other monks who were also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and said to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.1.6.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.
pli-tv-kd11:1.1.6.eng: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.

pli-tv-kd11:1.1.9.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.1.9.eng: Because of that, new quarrels started and existing quarrels became worse.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū attanā bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā, yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vakkhanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.2.eng: “How can the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka act like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.5.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.8.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattantī”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū attanā bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā, yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.14.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.17.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattantī”ti?

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.20.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ moghapurisānaṃ ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.20.eng: “It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.21.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā attanā bhaṇḍanakārakā …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.21.eng: How can they act like this,

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.22.pli: saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā, yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā …pe…

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.23.pli: saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vakkhanti—

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.26.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.29.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.29.eng: causing new quarrels to start and existing quarrels to become worse?

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.30.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya.

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.31.pli: Atha khvetaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānañceva appasādāya pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.2.31.eng: and cause some to lose it.”

pli-tv-kd11:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya mahicchatāya asantuṭṭhitāya saṅgaṇikāya kosajjassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā anekapariyāyena subharatāya suposatāya appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitvā bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd11:1.3.1.eng: The Buddha then spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:1.3.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ karotu.
pli-tv-kd11:1.3.2.eng: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.1.eng: And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū codetabbā, codetvā sāretabbā, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbā, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.2.eng: First you should accuse the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They should then be reminded of what they’ve done, before they’re charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.4.pli: Ime paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū attanā bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā, yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.4.eng: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.7.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.7.eng: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.10.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.10.eng: Because of this, new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.11.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.11.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.13.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.14.eng: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.15.eng: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.16.pli: yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.16.eng: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.19.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.19.eng: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.22.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.22.eng: Because of this, new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.23.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.24.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.24.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.25.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.26.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.27.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.28.eng: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.29.eng: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.30.pli: yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.30.eng: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.33.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.33.eng: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.36.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.36.eng: Because of this, new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.37.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.38.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.38.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.39.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.40.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.41.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.42.eng: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.43.eng: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.44.pli: yepi caññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā …pe… saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.44.eng: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.47.pli: Tumhe tena paṇḍitatarā ca byattatarā ca bahussutatarā ca alamattatarā ca.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.47.eng: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.50.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.50.eng: Because of this, new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.51.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.52.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.52.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.53.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.54.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:1.4.55.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:1.4.55.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.4.eng: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.5.comm: Sp 4.4: Adesanāgāminiyāti pārājikāpattiyā vā saṅghādisesāpattiyā vā, “‘Not clearable by confession’ means an offense entailing expulsion or an offense entailing suspension.”

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.7.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.7.eng: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.8.pli: Acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.8.eng: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.9.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.10.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.11.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.11.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.12.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.13.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.13.eng: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.14.pli: Appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.14.eng: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.15.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.16.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.16.eng: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.17.pli: Appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.17.eng: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.18.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.19.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.19.eng: “When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.20.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.20.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.21.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.22.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:2.1.22.eng: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:2.1.23.pli: Adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—

pli-tv-kd11:3.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:3.1.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:3.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:3.1.2.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:3.1.2.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:3.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:3.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.2.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.2.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.3.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.3.comm: According to CPD, apparently quoting the commentary (“Bu”), anapadāna means “‘who is unable to discern (what is an offense)’, or ‘not setting a good example’.” It is not clear, however, why apadāna should be rendered as “discern”. Sp 3.407: Apadānaṁ vuccati paricchedo; āpattiparicchedavirahitoti attho, “Limit is called apadāna; the meaning is ‘without limit to offenses’.” Sp-ṭ 3.395: Natthi etassa apadānaṁ avakhaṇḍanaṁ āpattipariyantoti anapadāno, “Anapadāno: he has no apadāna, no cutting off, no limit with offenses.”

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.4.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.4.comm: Sp 4.6: Ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehīti pabbajitānaṁ ananucchavikehi sahasokitādīhi gihisaṁsaggehi, “Ananulomikehi gihisaṁsaggehi: with unsuitable socializing for those gone forth, that is, sorrowing with (them), etc.” The “sorrowing with, etc.,” presumably refers to a passage found at SN 35.241. The impression given in this Sutta is that of fairly intense socializing.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.5.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.6.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.6.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.7.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.7.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.8.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.9.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.9.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.10.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:4.1.10.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:4.1.11.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.1.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.1.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.2.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.2.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.3.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.3.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.4.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.5.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.6.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.6.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.7.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.7.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.8.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.9.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.9.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.10.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:4.2.10.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.11.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, tajjanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:4.2.12.eng: The group of six on wishing is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of condemnation done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.3.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.4.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “formal support” for nissaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.5.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.6.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.7.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.8.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena tajjanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:5.1.8.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.9.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.10.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.12.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.13.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.14.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.15.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:5.1.15.comm: Sp 4.76: Na savacanīyaṁ kātabbanti palibodhatthāya vā pakkosanatthāya vā savacanīyaṁ na kātabbaṁ, palibodhatthāya hi karonto “ahaṁ āyasmantaṁ imasmiṁ vatthusmiṁ savacanīyaṁ karomi, imamhā āvāsā ekapadampi mā pakkāmi, yāva na taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ vūpasantaṁ hotī”ti evaṁ karoti. Pakkosanatthāya karonto “ahaṁ te savacanīyaṁ karomi, ehi mayā saddhiṁ vinayadharānaṁ sammukhībhāvaṁ gacchāmā”ti evaṁ karoti; tadubhayampi na kātabbaṁ, “Na savacanīyaṁ kātabba: savacanīya is not to be done for the purpose of (creating) an obstacle or for the purpose of summoning. Acting for the purpose of (creating) an obstacle is done like this: ‘I am doing savacanīya against the venerable in regard to this offense: do not depart from this monastery even with one foot so long as this legal issue has not been resolved.’ Acting for the purpose of summoning is done like this: ‘I am doing savacanīya against you: come with me and let us go to the presence of a master of the Monastic Law.’ Neither of these is to be done.” Sp-ṭ 4.76: Savacanīyanti sadosaṁ, “Savacanīyan: with flaw.” Vmv 4.76: Savacanīyanti ettha “sadosa”nti atthaṁ vadati. Attano vacane pavattanakammanti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo, “mā pakkamāhī”ti vā “ehi vinayadharānaṁ sammukhībhāva”nti vā evaṁ attano āṇāya pavattanakakammaṁ na kātabbanti adhippāyo. Evañhi kenaci savacanīye kate anādarena atikkamituṁ na vaṭṭati, buddhassa saṅghassa āṇā atikkantā nāma hoti, “Savacanīyan: here he says the meaning is ‘with flaw’. Here the meaning is to be understood as bringing about an action when speaking oneself: ‘Don’t leave,’ ‘Come to the presence of master of the Monastic Law’. The intention is one is not to do the bringing about of an action in this way because of a command from oneself.”

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.16.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:5.1.16.comm: Anuvāda is not listed in CPD, and based on the commentarial interpretation, both DOP and PED have the wrong definition. Sp 4.76: Na anuvādoti vihāre jeṭṭhakaṭṭhānaṁ na kātabbaṁ. Pātimokkhuddesakena vā dhammajjhesakena vā na bhavitabbaṁ. Nāpi terasasu sammutīsu ekasammutivasenāpi issariyakammaṁ kātabbaṁ, “Na anuvādo: in a monastery, one is not to be put in a senior position. One should not be the reciter of the Monastic Code or the one who requests someone to speak on the Dhamma. One is not to be made an authority even on account of one agreement among the thirteen agreements.” The thirteen agreements are the various offices of storeman, etc., that Sangha members may hold, see Sp-ṭ 1.69. Vjb 4.428: Anuvādanti issariyaṭṭhānaṁ, “Anuvādo: a position of authority.” Sp-yoj 4.76: Anuvādoti ettha anusāsanavasena aññe vadatīti, “Anuvādo: here one speaks to others on account of instructing (them).” The impression given here is that anuvāda means instructing others, especially from a position of authority.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.17.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.
pli-tv-kd11:5.1.17.comm: This literally means “an opportunity is not to be caused to be granted”. The idiomatic meaning is “he asks and gets permission” or usually “he asks and gets permission from someone to correct them”.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.18.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.19.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.20.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
pli-tv-kd11:5.1.20.comm: Sp 4.76: Na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti aññamaññaṁ yojetvā kalaho na kāretabbo, “Na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbaṁ means they should not quarrel when they engage with each other.” SRT reads na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti, which may be preferrable. It could then be rendered as “He should not create conflict between monks.” Whether the verb sampayojeti means to associate with or to cause conflict is not clear.

pli-tv-kd11:5.1.21.eng: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of condemnation are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:6.1.0.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:6.1.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ akāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:6.1.1.eng: When the Sangha had done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka,

pli-tv-kd11:6.1.2.pli: Te saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattanti, lomaṃ pātenti, netthāraṃ vattanti, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:6.1.2.eng: they conducted themselves properly and suitably, and deserved to be released. They then went to the monks
pli-tv-kd11:6.1.2.comm: The meaning of the first of these phrases, sammā vattati, is straightforward, but the last two, lomaṁ pāteti and netthāraṁ vattati, are more difficult. Commenting on Bu Ss 13, Sp 1.435 explains the negative version of these phrases thus: Na lomaṁ pātentīti anulomapaṭipadaṁ appaṭipajjanatāya na pannalomā honti. Na netthāraṁ vattantīti attano nittharaṇamaggaṁ na paṭipajjanti, “Na lomaṁ pātenti: because of their non-practicing in conformity with the path, their bodily hairs are not flat. Na netthāraṁ vattanti: they are not practicing the path for their own getting out (of the offense).” My rendering attempts to capture the meaning in a non-literal way.

pli-tv-kd11:6.1.3.pli: “mayaṃ, āvuso, saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattāma, lomaṃ pātema, netthāraṃ vattāma, kathaṃ nu kho amhehi paṭipajjitabban”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:6.1.3.eng: and told them about this, adding, “What should we do now?”

pli-tv-kd11:6.1.6.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:6.1.6.eng: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.1.eng: When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena tajjanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.8.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.8.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.9.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:6.2.9.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:6.2.11.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.0.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.2.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.2.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena tajjanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.5.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.6.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.6.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.8.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.8.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.9.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:7.1.9.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:7.1.11.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:8.1.1.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:8.1.2.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, paṇḍukalohitakehi bhikkhūhi saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:8.1.2.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should arrange their upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:8.1.3.pli: ‘mayaṃ, bhante, saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattāma, lomaṃ pātema, netthāraṃ vattāma, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against us. We’re now conducting ourselves properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. We ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:8.1.4.eng: And they should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:8.1.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.1.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.2.pli: Ime paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattanti, lomaṃ pātenti, netthāraṃ vattanti, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācanti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.2.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They’re now conducting themselves properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. They’re asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.5.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.6.pli: Ime paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattanti, lomaṃ pātenti, netthāraṃ vattanti, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācanti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.6.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They’re now conducting themselves properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. They’re asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.7.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.8.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.10.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.12.pli: Ime paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattanti, lomaṃ pātenti, netthāraṃ vattanti, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācanti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.12.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They’re now conducting themselves properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. They’re asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.13.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.14.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.14.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.15.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.16.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.17.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.18.pli: Ime paṇḍukalohitakā bhikkhū saṅghena tajjanīyakammakatā sammā vattanti, lomaṃ pātenti, netthāraṃ vattanti, tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācanti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.18.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They’re now conducting themselves properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. They’re asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.19.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati paṇḍukalohitakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tajjanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.20.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.22.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.23.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:8.2.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:8.2.24.eng: The first section on the legal procedure of condemnation is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā seyyasako bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.1.eng: At that time Venerable Seyyasaka was ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.2.eng: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3.eng: In addition, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3.comm: Sp 4.11: apissu bhikkhū pakatāti apissu bhikkhū niccaṁ byāvaṭā honti, “Apissu bhikkhū pakatā: in addition, the monks were regularly busy.”

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā seyyasako bālo bhavissati abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.5.eng: “How can Venerable Seyyasaka go on like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.7.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Seyyasaka goes on like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.12.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā”ti?

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.15.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, bhikkhave, tassa moghapurisassa ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.15.eng: “It’s not suitable for that foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.16.pli: Kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso bālo bhavissati abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.16.eng: How can he be ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries?

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.17.eng: How can he constantly and improperly socialize with householders?

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.18.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.18.eng: And how can it be that the monks regularly give him probation, send him back to the beginning, give him trial periods, and rehabilitate him?

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.21.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.22.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.22.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.22.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “demotion” for niyassa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.23.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.1.eng: And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.2.pli: Paṭhamaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.2.eng: First you should accuse the monk Seyyasaka. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.4.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.4.eng: This monk Seyyasaka is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.5.eng: He’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.6.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā.
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.6.eng: In addition, the monks regularly give him probation, send him back to the beginning, give him the trial period, and rehabilitate him.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.8.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.11.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.11.eng: This monk Seyyasaka is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.12.eng: He’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.13.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā.
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.13.eng: In addition, the monks regularly give him probation, send him back to the beginning, give him the trial period, and rehabilitate him.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.14.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.15.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.16.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.18.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.19.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.20.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.21.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.22.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu bālo abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.22.eng: This monk Seyyasaka is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.23.eng: He’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.24.pli: apissu bhikkhū pakatā parivāsaṃ dentā mūlāya paṭikassantā mānattaṃ dentā abbhentā.
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.24.eng: In addition, the monks regularly give him probation, send him back to the beginning, give him the trial period, and rehabilitate him.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.25.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.26.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.27.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.27.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.29.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.30.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.31.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:9.2.32.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:9.2.32.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.4.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.7.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.7.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.8.pli: Acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.8.eng: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.9.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.11.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.11.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.13.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.14.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.14.eng: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.16.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.17.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.17.eng: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.19.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.20.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.20.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.22.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.23.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.23.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.25.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.26.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.26.eng: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.28.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.29.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.29.eng: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.31.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.32.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.32.eng: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.34.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.34.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.35.pli: Āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.35.eng: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.36.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.37.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.38.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.38.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.38.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.39.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.39.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.40.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.41.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.41.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.42.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.42.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.43.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.44.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.44.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.45.pli: Codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.45.eng: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.46.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.47.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.48.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.48.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.50.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.51.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.51.eng: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.53.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.54.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.54.eng: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.56.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.57.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.57.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.59.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.60.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.60.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.62.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.63.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.63.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.65.eng: “When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.66.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.66.eng: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.68.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.69.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.69.eng: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.71.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.71.eng: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.72.pli: Āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.72.eng: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.73.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ niyassakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.74.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.76.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.76.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.77.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.78.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.79.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.80.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.80.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.81.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.81.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.82.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.83.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.83.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.84.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.84.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.85.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.86.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.86.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.87.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.87.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.88.pli: eko bālo hoti, abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.88.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.89.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.90.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.91.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.91.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.92.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.92.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.93.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.94.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.94.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.95.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.95.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.96.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, niyassakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.97.eng: The group of six on wishing is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.98.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.100.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.102.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.103.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.104.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.105.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:10.1.105.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.106.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.107.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.109.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.110.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.111.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.112.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.113.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.114.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.115.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.116.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.117.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.118.eng: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of demotion are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:11.1.1.eng: Soon the Sangha did a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.2.eng: instructing him to live with formal support.

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.3.pli: So saṅghena niyassakammakato kalyāṇamitte sevamāno bhajamāno payirupāsamāno uddisāpento paripucchanto bahussuto hoti, āgatāgamo dhammadharo vinayadharo mātikādharo paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī lajjī kukkuccako sikkhākāmo.
pli-tv-kd11:11.1.3.eng: Then, by associating with good friends, by having them recite, and by questioning them, he became learned and a master of the tradition; he became an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Key Terms; he became knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
pli-tv-kd11:11.1.3.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “training” for vinaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.4.pli: Sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd11:11.1.4.eng: And he conducted himself properly and suitably, and deserved to be released. He then went to the monks

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.5.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.8.eng: He had the monks gathered and said,

pli-tv-kd11:11.1.9.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:11.1.9.eng: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.”

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.0.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.8.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.8.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.9.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.9.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.11.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.0.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.13.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.13.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.14.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.15.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.15.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.16.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena niyassakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.16.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.17.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.17.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.18.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.19.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.19.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.20.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:11.2.20.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.21.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:11.2.22.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:12.1.1.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:12.1.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, seyyasakena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:12.1.2.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the monk Seyyasaka should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:12.1.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:12.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against me. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:12.1.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.1.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.3.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.3.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.6.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.7.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.7.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.8.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.9.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.9.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.10.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.11.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.12.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.13.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.13.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.14.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.15.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.15.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.16.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.17.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.18.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.19.pli: Ayaṃ seyyasako bhikkhu saṅghena niyassakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.19.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.20.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.21.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati seyyasakassa bhikkhuno niyassassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.21.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.22.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.23.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.24.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:12.2.24.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:12.2.25.eng: The second section on the legal procedure of demotion is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikā honti alajjino pāpabhikkhū.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1.eng: At one time the bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka were staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.2.eng: They were misbehaving in many ways.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3.pli: mālāvacchaṃ ropentipi ropāpentipi, siñcantipi siñcāpentipi, ocinantipi ocināpentipi, ganthentipi ganthāpentipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, āveḷaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, uracchadaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3.eng: They planted flowering trees, watered and plucked them, and then tied the flowers together. They made the flowers into garlands, garlands with stalks on one side and garlands with stalks on both sides. They made flower arrangements, wreaths, ornaments for the head, ornaments for the ears, and ornaments for the chest. And they had others do the same.
