pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4.pli: Te kulitthīnaṃ kuladhītānaṃ kulakumārīnaṃ kulasuṇhānaṃ kuladāsīnaṃ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, āveḷaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, uracchadaṃ harantipi harāpentipi.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4.eng: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughters-in-law, and the female slaves of respectable families.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5.pli: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṃ ekabhājanepi bhuñjanti, ekathālakepi pivanti, ekāsanepi nisīdanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, vikālepi bhuñjanti, majjampi pivanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhārenti, naccantipi, gāyantipi, vādentipi, lāsentipi;
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5.eng: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6.pli: naccantiyāpi naccanti, naccantiyāpi gāyanti, naccantiyāpi vādenti, naccantiyāpi lāsenti;
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6.eng: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.7.pli: gāyantiyāpi naccanti, gāyantiyāpi gāyanti, gāyantiyāpi vādenti, gāyantiyāpi lāsenti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.8.pli: vādentiyāpi naccanti, vādentiyāpi gāyanti, vādentiyāpi vādenti, vādentiyāpi lāsenti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.9.pli: lāsentiyāpi naccanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyanti, lāsentiyāpi vādenti, lāsentiyāpi lāsenti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1.pli: aṭṭhapadepi kīḷanti, dasapadepi kīḷanti, ākāsepi kīḷanti, parihārapathepi kīḷanti, santikāyapi kīḷanti, khalikāyapi kīḷanti, ghaṭikāyapi kīḷanti, salākahatthenapi kīḷanti, akkhenapi kīḷanti, paṅgacīrenapi kīḷanti, vaṅkakenapi kīḷanti, mokkhacikāyapi kīḷanti, ciṅgulakenapi kīḷanti, pattāḷhakenapi kīḷanti, rathakenapi kīḷanti, dhanukenapi kīḷanti, akkharikāyapi kīḷanti, manesikāyapi kīḷanti, yathāvajjenapi kīḷanti;
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1.eng: They played various games: eight-row checkers, ten-row checkers, imaginary checkers, hopscotch, pick-up-sticks, board games, tip-cat, painting with the hand, dice, leaf flutes, toy plows, somersaults, pinwheels, toy measures, toy carriages, toy bows, guessing from syllables, thought guessing, mimicking deformities.

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2.pli: hatthismimpi sikkhanti, assasmimpi sikkhanti, rathasmimpi sikkhanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhanti, tharusmimpi sikkhanti;
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2.eng: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3.pli: hatthissapi purato dhāvanti, assassapi purato dhāvanti, rathassapi purato dhāvantipi ādhāvantipi;
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3.eng: And they ran in front of elephants, in front of horses, and in front of carriages, and they ran backward and forward.

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.4.eng: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5.pli: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5.eng: They spread their outer robe on a stage and said to the dancing girls,

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.7.eng: and they made gestures of approval.

pli-tv-kd11:13.2.8.eng: And they misbehaved in a variety of ways.

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kāsīsu vassaṃvuṭṭho sāvatthiṃ gacchanto bhagavantaṃ dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tadavasari.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1.eng: Just then a monk who had completed the rains residence in Kāsi was on his way to visit the Buddha at Sāvatthī when he arrived at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kīṭāgiriṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi pāsādikena abhikkantena paṭikkantena ālokitena vilokitena samiñjitena pasāritena, okkhittacakkhu iriyāpathasampanno.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2.eng: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood. He was pleasing in his conduct: in going out and coming back, in looking ahead and looking aside, in bending and stretching his arms. His eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.3.eng: When people saw him, they said,

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4.pli: “kvāyaṃ abalabalo viya mandamando viya bhākuṭikabhākuṭiko viya?
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4.eng: “Who’s this, acting like a moron and always frowning?

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.5.eng: Who’s gonna give almsfood to him?

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6.pli: Amhākaṃ pana ayyā assajipunabbasukā saṇhā sakhilā sukhasambhāsā mihitapubbaṅgamā ehisvāgatavādino abbhākuṭikā uttānamukhā pubbabhāsino.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6.eng: Almsfood should be given to our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka, for they’re gentle, congenial, pleasant to speak with, greeting one with a smile, welcoming, friendly, open, the first to speak.”

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8.pli: Addasā kho aññataro upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8.eng: A certain lay follower saw that monk walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9.pli: disvāna yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9.eng: He approached him, bowed, and said,

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1.pli: Atha kho so upāsako taṃ bhikkhuṃ gharaṃ netvā bhojetvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1.eng: He took that monk to his house and gave him a meal.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.2.eng: He then said, “Where are you going, venerable?”

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3.pli: “Sāvatthiṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, gamissāmi bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3.eng: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4.pli: “Tena hi, bhante, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda, evañca vadehi—
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4.eng: “Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.5.eng: ‘Sir, the monastery at Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6.pli: Assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6.eng: The bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are staying there.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.7.eng: And they’re misbehaving in many ways.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8.pli: mālāvacchaṃ ropentipi ropāpentipi, siñcantipi siñcāpentipi, ocinantipi ocināpentipi, ganthentipi ganthāpentipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, āveḷaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, uracchadaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8.eng: They plant flowering trees, water them …

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.9.pli: Te kulitthīnaṃ kuladhītānaṃ kulakumārīnaṃ kulasuṇhānaṃ kuladāsīnaṃ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, āveḷaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, uracchadaṃ harantipi harāpentipi.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.10.pli: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṃ ekabhājanepi bhuñjanti, ekathālakepi pivanti, ekāsanepi nisīdanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, vikālepi bhuñjanti, majjampi pivanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhārenti, naccantipi, gāyantipi, vādentipi, lāsentipi;

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.11.pli: naccantiyāpi naccanti, naccantiyāpi gāyanti, naccantiyāpi vādenti, naccantiyāpi lāsenti …pe…

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.13.pli: Lāsentiyāpi naccanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyanti, lāsentiyāpi vādenti, lāsentiyāpi lāsenti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.14.pli: aṭṭhapadepi kīḷanti, dasapadepi kīḷanti, ākāsepi kīḷanti, parihārapathepi kīḷanti, santikāyapi kīḷanti, khalikāyapi kīḷanti, ghaṭikāyapi kīḷanti, salākahatthenapi kīḷanti, akkhenapi kīḷanti, paṅgacīrenapi kīḷanti, vaṅkakenapi kīḷanti, mokkhacikāyapi kīḷanti, ciṅgulakenapi kīḷanti, pattāḷhakenapi kīḷanti, rathakenapi kīḷanti, dhanukenapi kīḷanti, akkharikāyapi kīḷanti, manesikāyapi kīḷanti, yathāvajjenapi kīḷanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.15.pli: hatthismimpi sikkhanti, assasmimpi sikkhanti, rathasmimpi sikkhanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhanti, tharusmimpi sikkhanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.16.pli: hatthissapi purato dhāvanti, assassapi purato dhāvanti, rathassapi purato dhāvantipi ādhāvantipi;

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.18.pli: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti—

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.21.eng: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22.pli: Yepi te, bhante, manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṃ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22.eng: Those who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23.pli: Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23.eng: and there’s no longer any support for the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.24.eng: The good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on.

pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā kīṭāgiriṃ bhikkhū pahiṇeyya, yathāyaṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāso saṇṭhaheyyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25.eng: Sir, please send monks to stay at the monastery in Kīṭāgiri.’”

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho so bhikkhu tassa upāsakassa paṭissuṇitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1.eng: The monk agreed, got up, and set out for Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2.pli: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha and sat down.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.5.eng: “I hope you are keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.6.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.7.eng: And where have you come from?”

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.8.eng: “I’m keeping well, sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.9.pli: appakilamathena ca ahaṃ, bhante, addhānaṃ āgato.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.10.pli: Idhāhaṃ, bhante, kāsīsu vassaṃvuṭṭho sāvatthiṃ āgacchanto bhagavantaṃ dassanāya yena kīṭāgiri tadavasariṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.10.eng: He then told the Buddha all that had happened at Kīṭāgiri,

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.11.pli: Atha khvāhaṃ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya kīṭāgiriṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.12.pli: Addasā kho maṃ, bhante, aññataro upāsako kīṭāgirismiṃ piṇḍāya carantaṃ;

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.13.pli: disvāna yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.17.pli: Atha kho, bhante, so upāsako maṃ gharaṃ netvā bhojetvā etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.19.pli: ‘Sāvatthiṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, gamissāmi bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā’ti.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.20.pli: ‘Tena hi, bhante, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda, evañca vadehi—

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.22.pli: Assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.26.pli: Yepi te, bhante, manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṃ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.27.pli: Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.29.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā kīṭāgiriṃ bhikkhū pahiṇeyya, yathāyaṃ kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāso saṇṭhaheyyā”’ti.

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.30.eng: adding, “That’s where I’ve come from, sir.”

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.2.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, assajipunabbasukā nāma kīṭāgirismiṃ āvāsikā alajjino pāpabhikkhū?
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.2.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are staying at Kīṭāgiri and misbehaving in this way?

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.6.pli: Yepi te manussā pubbe saddhā ahesuṃ pasannā tepi etarahi assaddhā appasannā?
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.6.eng: And is it true that those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.7.pli: Yānipi tāni saṅghassa pubbe dānapathāni tānipi etarahi upacchinnāni?
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.7.eng: that there’s no longer any support for the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.8.eng: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on?”

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.12.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā evarūpaṃ anācāraṃ ācarissanti—
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.12.eng: How can those foolish men misbehave in this way?

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.13.pli: mālāvacchaṃ ropessantipi ropāpessantipi, siñcissantipi siñcāpessantipi, ocinissantipi ocināpessantipi, ganthessantipi ganthāpessantipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, mañjarikaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, vidhūtikaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, āveḷaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, uracchadaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi.

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.14.pli: Te kulitthīnaṃ kuladhītānaṃ kulakumārīnaṃ kulasuṇhānaṃ kuladāsīnaṃ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, mañjarikaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, vidhūtikaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, āveḷaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi, uracchadaṃ harissantipi harāpessantipi.

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.15.pli: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṃ ekabhājanepi bhuñjissanti, ekathālakepi pivissanti, ekāsanepi nisīdissanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭissanti, ekattharaṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭissanti, vikālepi bhuñjissanti, majjampi pivissanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhāressanti, naccissantipi, gāyissantipi, vādessantipi, lāsessantipi;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.16.pli: naccantiyāpi naccissanti, naccantiyāpi gāyissanti, naccantiyāpi vādessanti, naccantiyāpi lāsessanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.17.pli: gāyantiyāpi naccissanti, gāyantiyāpi gāyissanti, gāyantiyāpi vādessanti, gāyantiyāpi lāsessanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.18.pli: vādentiyāpi naccissanti, vādentiyāpi gāyissanti, vādentiyāpi vādessanti, vādentiyāpi lāsessanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.19.pli: lāsentiyāpi naccissanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyissanti, lāsentiyāpi vādessanti, lāsentiyāpi lāsessanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.20.pli: aṭṭhapadepi kīḷissanti, dasapadepi kīḷissanti, ākāsepi kīḷissanti, parihārapathepi kīḷissanti, santikāyapi kīḷissanti, khalikāyapi kīḷissanti, ghaṭikāyapi kīḷissanti, salākahatthenapi kīḷissanti, akkhenapi kīḷissanti, paṅgacīrenapi kīḷissanti, vaṅkakenapi kīḷissanti mokkhacikāyapi kīḷissanti, ciṅgulakenapi kīḷissanti, pattāḷhakenapi kīḷissanti, rathakenapi kīḷissanti, dhanukenapi kīḷissanti, akkharikāyapi kīḷissanti, manesikāyapi kīḷissanti, yathāvajjenapi kīḷissanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.21.pli: hatthismimpi sikkhissanti, assasmimpi sikkhissanti, rathasmimpi sikkhissanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhissanti, tharusmimpi sikkhissanti;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.22.pli: hatthissapi purato dhāvissanti, assassapi purato dhāvissanti, rathassapi purato dhāvissantipi ādhāvissantipi;

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.24.pli: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vakkhanti—

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.30.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed Sāriputta and Moggallāna:

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.31.pli: “gacchatha tumhe, sāriputtā, kīṭāgiriṃ gantvā assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ karotha, tumhākaṃ ete saddhivihārino”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.31.eng: “Go to Kīṭāgiri and do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka. They’re your students.”

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.32.pli: “Kathaṃ mayaṃ, bhante, assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ karoma, caṇḍā te bhikkhū pharusā”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:13.6.32.eng: “Sir, how can we do a procedure of banishing these monks from Kīṭāgiri? They’re temperamental and harsh.”

pli-tv-kd11:13.6.33.pli: “Tena hi tumhe, sāriputtā, bahukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ gacchathā”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.1.eng: “And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.2.pli: paṭhamaṃ assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū codetabbā, codetvā sāretabbā, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbā, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.2.eng: First you should accuse the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka. They should then be reminded of what they’ve done, before they’re charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.4.eng: These monks, Assaji and Punabbasuka, are corrupters of families and badly behaved.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.5.pli: Imesaṃ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.5.eng: Their bad behavior is seen and heard about,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.6.pli: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.6.eng: and the families corrupted by them are seen and heard about.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of banishing them,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.8.eng: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.11.eng: These monks, Assaji and Punabbasuka, are corrupters of families and badly behaved.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.12.pli: Imesaṃ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.12.eng: Their bad behavior is seen and heard about,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.13.pli: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.13.eng: and the families corrupted by them are seen and heard about.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.14.pli: Saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.14.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing them,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.15.eng: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṃ vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.16.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.17.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.18.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.19.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.20.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.21.eng: These monks, Assaji and Punabbasuka, are corrupters of families and badly behaved.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.22.pli: Imesaṃ pāpakā samācārā dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.22.eng: Their bad behavior is seen and heard about,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.23.pli: Kulāni ca imehi duṭṭhāni dissanti ceva suyyanti ca.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.23.eng: and the families corrupted by them are seen and heard about.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.24.pli: Saṅgho assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.24.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of banishing them,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.25.eng: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.26.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—na assajipunabbasukehi bhikkhūhi kīṭāgirismiṃ vatthabbanti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.26.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.27.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.28.pli: Kataṃ saṅghena assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.28.eng: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka,

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.29.eng: prohibiting them from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:13.7.30.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:13.7.30.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.4.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.6.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.6.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.7.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.7.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.8.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.8.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.9.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.9.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.10.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.11.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.11.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.12.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.12.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.13.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.13.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.14.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.14.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.15.pli: āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.15.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.17.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.19.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.19.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.20.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.21.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.21.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.22.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.22.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.23.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.23.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.24.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.24.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.25.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.25.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.26.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.26.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.27.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.27.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.28.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.28.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.29.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.29.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.30.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.30.eng: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.31.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.31.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.32.pli: āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.32.eng: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.33.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ pabbājanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.34.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.0.eng: The group of fourteen on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.36.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.36.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.37.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.38.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.39.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.40.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.40.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.41.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.41.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.42.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.43.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.43.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.44.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.44.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.45.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.46.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.46.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.47.pli: Kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.47.eng: his bodily conduct is frivolous; his verbal conduct is frivolous; his bodily and verbal conduct are frivolous.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.48.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.49.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.49.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.50.pli: Kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.50.eng: he’s improperly behaved by body; he’s improperly behaved by speech; he’s improperly behaved by body and speech.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.51.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.52.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.52.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.53.pli: Kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.53.eng: his bodily conduct is harmful; his verbal conduct is harmful; his bodily and verbal conduct are harmful.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.54.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.55.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.55.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.56.pli: Kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.56.eng: he has wrong livelihood by body; he has wrong livelihood by speech; he has wrong livelihood by body and speech.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.57.pli: imehi, kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.1.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.1.eng: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.2.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.2.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.3.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.3.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.4.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.5.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.6.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.6.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.7.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.7.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.8.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.9.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.9.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.10.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.10.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.11.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.12.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.12.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.13.pli: Eko kāyikena davena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena davena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena davena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.13.eng: those who are frivolous in bodily conduct; those who are frivolous in verbal conduct; those who are frivolous in bodily and verbal conduct.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.14.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.15.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.15.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.16.pli: Eko kāyikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena anācārena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.16.eng: those who are improperly behaved by body; those who are improperly behaved by speech; those who are improperly behaved by body and speech.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.17.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.18.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.18.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.19.pli: Eko kāyikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena upaghātikena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.19.eng: those whose bodily conduct is harmful; those whose verbal conduct is harmful; those whose bodily and verbal conduct are harmful.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.20.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.21.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.21.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishment against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.22.pli: Eko kāyikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, eko vācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti, eko kāyikavācasikena micchājīvena samannāgato hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:14.2.22.eng: those who have wrong livelihood by body; those who have wrong livelihood by speech; those who have wrong livelihood by body and speech.”

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.23.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pabbājanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:14.2.24.eng: The group of fourteen on wishing is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.3.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.5.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.6.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.7.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.8.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:15.1.8.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.9.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.10.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.12.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.13.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.14.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.15.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.16.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.17.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.18.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.19.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.20.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:15.1.21.eng: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of banishment are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.1.pli: Atha kho sāriputtamoggallānappamukho bhikkhusaṅgho kīṭāgiriṃ gantvā assajipunabbasukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kīṭāgirismā pabbājanīyakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards a sangha of monks, headed by Sāriputta and Moggallāna, went to Kīṭāgiri and did the legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka,

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.2.eng: prohibiting them from staying at Kīṭāgiri.

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.3.pli: Te saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattanti, na lomaṃ pātenti, na netthāraṃ vattanti;
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.3.eng: Even so, they did not conduct themselves properly or suitably so as to deserve to be released,

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.4.eng: nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness. Instead they abused and reviled them,

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.5.eng: and they slandered them as acting from favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.6.eng: And they left and they disrobed.
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.6.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “disrobe” for vibbhamati, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattissanti, na lomaṃ pātessanti, na netthāraṃ vattissanti;
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.8.eng: “How can these monks act like this when the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing them?”

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattanti, na lomaṃ pātenti, na netthāraṃ vattanti;
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.21.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā na sammā vattissanti, na lomaṃ pātessanti, na netthāraṃ vattissanti;
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.21.eng: How can those foolish men act like this?

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.27.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.28.eng: “Well then, don’t lift that legal procedure of banishment.”
pli-tv-kd11:16.1.28.comm: MS reads, tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho pabbājanīyakammaṁ paṭippassambhetu, “Well then, monks, lift that procedure of banishment”, which must be an error. I here follow the text as found in the PTS edition, tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho pabbājanīyakammaṁ na paṭippassambhetu.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.0.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.8.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.8.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.9.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.9.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.11.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.0.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.13.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.13.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.14.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.15.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.15.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.16.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pabbājanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.16.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.17.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.17.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.18.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.19.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.19.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.20.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:16.2.20.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.21.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:16.2.22.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:17.1.1.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:17.1.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, pabbājanīyakammakatena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:17.1.2.eng: After approaching the Sangha, the monk who’s had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:17.1.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:17.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing me. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:17.1.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:17.1.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.1.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.2.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.2.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.3.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.3.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.5.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.6.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.6.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.7.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.8.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.8.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.9.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.10.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.11.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.12.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.13.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.13.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.14.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of banishing him.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.15.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pabbājanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.15.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.16.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.17.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.18.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:17.2.18.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:17.2.19.eng: The second section on the legal procedure of banishment is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sudhammo macchikāsaṇḍe cittassa gahapatino āvāsiko hoti, navakammiko dhuvabhattiko.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Sudhamma was the staying at the householder Citta’s monastery at Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of the building work and received a regular supply of food.

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2.pli: Yadā citto gahapati saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā puggalaṃ vā nimantetukāmo hoti tadā na āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā puggalaṃ vā nimanteti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2.eng: Whenever Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from Sudhamma.

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā therā bhikkhū, āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno, āyasmā ca mahākaccāno, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko, āyasmā ca mahākappino, āyasmā ca mahācundo, āyasmā ca anuruddho, āyasmā ca revato, āyasmā ca upāli, āyasmā ca ānando, āyasmā ca rāhulo, kāsīsu cārikaṃ caramānā yena macchikāsaṇḍo tadavasaruṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3.eng: On one occasion a number of senior monks—Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, Venerable Rāhula—were wandering in Kāsi, when they arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4.pli: Assosi kho citto gahapati therā kira bhikkhū macchikāsaṇḍaṃ anuppattāti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4.eng: When Citta heard that they had arrived,

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5.pli: Atha kho citto gahapati yena therā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā there bhikkhū abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5.eng: he went to them, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho cittaṃ gahapatiṃ āyasmā sāriputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6.eng: After Sāriputta had instructed, inspired, and gladdened Citta with a teaching,

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.7.pli: Atha kho citto gahapati āyasmatā sāriputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito there bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.8.eng: “Venerables, please accept a meal for newly-arrived monks from me tomorrow.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1.pli: Atha kho citto gahapati therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ adhivāsanaṃ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā there bhikkhū abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yenāyasmā sudhammo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1.eng: When he knew that they had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and went to Sudhamma. He bowed to him

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho citto gahapati āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, ayyo sudhammo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ therehī”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3.eng: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5.pli: “pubbe khvāyaṃ citto gahapati yadā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā puggalaṃ vā nimantetukāmo na maṃ anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā puggalaṃ vā nimanteti;
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5.eng: “Previously when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he wouldn’t do so without getting my permission.

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.6.pli: sodāni maṃ anapaloketvā there bhikkhū nimantesi;

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7.pli: duṭṭhodānāyaṃ citto gahapati anapekkho virattarūpo mayī”ti cittaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7.eng: He’s been corrupted, this Citta. He’s uninterested and has no affection for me.” He said to Citta,

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.10.pli: tatiyampi kho citto gahapati āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.11.pli: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, ayyo sudhammo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ therehī”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14.pli: “kiṃ me karissati ayyo sudhammo adhivāsento vā anadhivāsento vā”ti āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14.eng: “What difference does it make to me whether Sudhamma accepts or not?” He then bowed, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1.pli: Atha kho citto gahapati tassā rattiyā accayena therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpesi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1.eng: The following morning Citta prepared various kinds of fine foods for the senior monks.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ cittassa gahapatino therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭiyattaṃ passeyyan”ti pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena cittassa gahapatino nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3.eng: “Why don’t I go and see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks?” He then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4.pli: Atha kho citto gahapati yenāyasmā sudhammo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sudhammaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4.eng: Citta approached Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho cittaṃ gahapatiṃ āyasmā sudhammo etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6.pli: “pahūtaṃ kho te idaṃ, gahapati, khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyattaṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6.eng: “You have prepared many kinds of food.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7.pli: ekā ca kho idha natthi yadidaṃ tilasaṅguḷikā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7.eng: But there’s one that’s missing: sesame cookies.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7.comm: According to the commentary this is an insult. Citta had a relative who was a baker, a low class occupation. By asking for sesame cookies, Sudhamma was apparently trying to remind Citta of his low class relative, thereby insulting him.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8.pli: “Bahumhi vata, bhante, ratane buddhavacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yadeva kiñci bhāsitaṃ yadidaṃ tilasaṅguḷikāti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8.eng: “When there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, sir, you speak of sesame cookies.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhante, dakkhiṇāpathakā vāṇijā puratthimaṃ janapadaṃ agamaṃsu vāṇijjāya.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9.eng: In the past there were some traders from the south who went to an eastern country to trade.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.10.eng: From there they brought back a hen.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11.pli: Atha kho sā, bhante, kukkuṭī kākena saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11.eng: That hen mated with a crow

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.12.eng: and because of that she had a chick.

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13.pli: Yadā kho so, bhante, kukkuṭapotako kākavassaṃ vassitukāmo hoti, kākakukkuṭīti vassati;
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13.eng: When that chick wanted to caw like a crow, it cried, ‘caw-ca-doodle-doo.’

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14.pli: yadā kukkuṭivassaṃ vassitukāmo hoti, kukkuṭikākāti vassati.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14.eng: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’

pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15.pli: Evameva kho, bhante, bahumhi ratane buddhavacane vijjamāne ayyena sudhammena yadeva kiñci bhāsitaṃ yadidaṃ tilasaṅguḷikā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15.eng: In the same way, when there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, you speak of sesame cookies.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.1.pli: “Akkosasi maṃ tvaṃ, gahapati, paribhāsasi maṃ tvaṃ, gahapati.

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.6.eng: I’ll do my best to provide you with robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.7.eng: Sudhamma repeated what he had said a second time and Citta responded as before.

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.8.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmā sudhammo cittaṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.8.eng: When Sudhamma repeated it a third time,

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.9.pli: “akkosasi maṃ tvaṃ, gahapati, paribhāsasi maṃ tvaṃ, gahapati.

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.12.pli: “Sāvatthiṃ kho ahaṃ, gahapati, gamissāmi bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.12.eng: “I’ll go to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.13.pli: “Tena hi, bhante, yañca attanā bhaṇitaṃ, yañca mayā bhaṇitaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocehi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.13.eng: “Well then, please tell the Buddha of our entire conversation.

pli-tv-kd11:18.4.14.pli: Anacchariyaṃ kho panetaṃ, bhante, yaṃ ayyo sudhammo punadeva macchikāsaṇḍaṃ paccāgaccheyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.14.eng: And I would not be surprised if you returned to Macchikāsaṇḍa.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.1.eng: Sudhamma put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and left for Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.2.pli: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.2.eng: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha, sat down,

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sudhammo yañca attanā bhaṇitaṃ yañca cittena gahapatinā bhaṇitaṃ taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.3.eng: and told him about the conversation he had had with Citta.

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.5.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.5.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.6.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, cittaṃ gahapatiṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ dāyakaṃ kārakaṃ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṃ hīnena khuṃsessasi, hīnena vambhessasi?
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.6.eng: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who’s a donor, benefactor, and supporter of the Sangha?

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.9.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.10.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.10.eng: “Well then, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:18.5.11.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.1.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.2.pli: paṭhamaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.2.eng: First you should accuse the monk Sudhamma. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.4.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṃ gahapatiṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ dāyakaṃ kārakaṃ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṃ hīnena khuṃseti, hīnena vambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.4.eng: This monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who’s a donor, benefactor, and supporter of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.6.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.8.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.9.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṃ gahapatiṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ dāyakaṃ kārakaṃ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṃ hīnena khuṃseti, hīnena vambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.9.eng: This monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who’s a donor, benefactor, and supporter of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.10.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.11.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.12.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.12.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.13.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.14.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.15.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.16.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.17.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu cittaṃ gahapatiṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ dāyakaṃ kārakaṃ saṅghupaṭṭhākaṃ hīnena khuṃseti, hīnena vambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.17.eng: This monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who’s a donor, benefactor, and supporter of the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.18.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.19.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—citto te gahapati khamāpetabboti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.20.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.22.eng: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.23.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.24.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.24.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15.pli: āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.17.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.20.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30.eng: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.32.pli: āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.32.eng: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.33.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.34.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
