pli-tv-kd11:20.1.0.eng: The group of four on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2.pli: Gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, gihīnaṃ anāvāsāya parisakkati, gihī akkosati paribhāsati, gihī gihīhi bhedeti—
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2.eng: he’s trying to stop householders from getting things; he’s trying to harm householders; he’s trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; he abuses and reviles householders; he causes division between householders.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5.pli: Gihīnaṃ buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, gihīnaṃ dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, gihīnaṃ saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, gihī hīnena khuṃseti hīnena vambheti, gihīnaṃ dhammikaṃ paṭissavaṃ na saccāpeti—
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5.eng: he disparages the Buddha to householders; he disparages the Teaching to householders; he disparages the Sangha to householders; he demeans and insults householders; he doesn’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7.pli: Pañcannaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against five kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8.pli: Eko gihīnaṃ alābhāya parisakkati, eko gihīnaṃ anatthāya parisakkati, eko gihīnaṃ anāvāsāya parisakkati, eko gihī akkosati paribhāsati, eko gihī gihīhi bhedeti—
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8.eng: those who are trying to stop householders from getting things; those who are trying to harm householders; those who are trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; those who abuse and revile householders; those who cause division between householders.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.9.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against another five kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11.pli: Eko gihīnaṃ buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko gihīnaṃ dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko gihīnaṃ saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko gihī hīnena khuṃseti hīnena vambheti, eko gihīnaṃ dhammikaṃ paṭissavaṃ na saccāpeti—
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11.eng: those who disparage the Buddha to householders; those who disparage the Teaching to householders; those who disparage the Sangha to householders; those who demean and insult householders; those who don’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.”

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.12.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:20.1.13.eng: The group of four on wishing is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.3.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.5.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.6.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.7.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.9.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.10.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.12.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.13.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.14.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.15.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.16.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.17.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.18.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.19.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.20.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:21.1.21.eng: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.2.eng: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.3.pli: So saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato macchikāsaṇḍaṃ gantvā maṅkubhūto nāsakkhi cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.3.eng: He went to Macchikāsaṇḍa, but feeling humiliated, he was unable to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.6.eng: if he had asked Citta for forgiveness,

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.7.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, macchikāsaṇḍaṃ gantvā maṅkubhūto nāsakkhiṃ cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.7.eng: and he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-kd11:22.1.8.eng: The monks told the Buddha. He had the monks gathered and said:

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.1.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṃ detu—
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.1.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should give a companion messenger to Sudhamma

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.3.eng: And this is how the messenger should be given.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.4.pli: paṭhamaṃ bhikkhu yācitabbo, yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.4.eng: First you should ask a monk, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.5.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.6.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṃ dadeyya cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.6.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.8.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.9.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtaṃ deti cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.9.eng: The Sangha gives monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.10.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūtassa dānaṃ cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetuṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.10.eng: Any monk who approves of this should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.11.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.12.pli: Dinno saṅghena itthannāmo bhikkhu sudhammassa bhikkhuno anudūto cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.12.eng: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:22.2.13.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.13.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.1.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, sudhammena bhikkhunā anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ macchikāsaṇḍaṃ gantvā citto gahapati khamāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.1.eng: Sudhamma should now go to Macchikāsaṇḍa with that monk as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness, saying,

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.2.eng: ‘Please forgive me, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.3.eng: If he forgives, all is well.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.4.pli: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.4.eng: If not, the companion messenger should say,

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.5.eng: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; he wishes to reconcile with you.’

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.6.eng: If he forgives, all is well.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.7.pli: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.7.eng: If not, the companion messenger should say,

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.8.pli: ‘khama, gahapati, imassa bhikkhuno, ahaṃ taṃ pasādemī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.8.eng: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.9.eng: If he forgives, all is well.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.10.pli: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā vattabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.10.eng: If not, the companion messenger should say,

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.11.eng: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I ask in the name of the Sangha.’

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.12.eng: If he forgives, all is well.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.13.pli: No ce khamati, anudūtena bhikkhunā sudhammo bhikkhu cittassa gahapatino dassanūpacāraṃ avijahāpetvā savanūpacāraṃ avijahāpetvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ kārāpetvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdāpetvā añjaliṃ paggaṇhāpetvā taṃ āpattiṃ desāpetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.13.eng: If not, then within sight and hearing of Citta, the monk Sudhamma should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and confess that offense.”

pli-tv-kd11:23.1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sudhammo anudūtena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ macchikāsaṇḍaṃ gantvā cittaṃ gahapatiṃ khamāpesi.
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards Sudhamma went to Macchikāsaṇḍa with a monk as a companion messenger, and he asked Citta for forgiveness.

pli-tv-kd11:23.1.2.pli: So sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.2.eng: And he conducted himself properly and suitably, and deserved to be released. He then went to the monks

pli-tv-kd11:23.1.3.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd11:23.1.5.eng: The monks told the Buddha. He had the monks gathered and said,

pli-tv-kd11:23.1.6.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.6.eng: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma.”

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.0.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.8.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.8.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.9.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.9.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.11.eng: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.0.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.13.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.13.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.14.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.15.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.15.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.16.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.16.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.17.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.17.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.18.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.19.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.19.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.20.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.20.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.21.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.22.eng: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.1.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, sudhammena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.2.eng: The monk Sudhamma should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against me. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.8.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.8.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.12.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.12.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.13.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.14.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.14.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.15.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.16.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.17.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.18.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.19.pli: Ayaṃ sudhammo bhikkhu saṅghena paṭisāraṇīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.19.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.20.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of reconciliation against him.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.21.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati sudhammassa bhikkhuno paṭisāraṇīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.21.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.22.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.23.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma.

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.24.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:24.1.24.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:24.1.25.eng: The fourth section on the legal procedure of reconciliation is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.0.eng: 5. The legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passituṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to recognize it.

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṃ passitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.4.eng: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?”

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passitun”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṃ passituṃ?
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.11.eng: How can Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.14.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.15.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd11:25.1.15.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.1.16.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.1.eng: And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.2.pli: paṭhamaṃ channo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.2.eng: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.4.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passituṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.4.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.5.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.6.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.8.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.9.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passituṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.9.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.10.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.10.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.11.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.12.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.12.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.14.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.15.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.16.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.17.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.18.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ passituṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.18.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.19.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.19.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.20.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.21.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.21.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.23.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.24.pli: Kataṃ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.24.eng: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.25.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.26.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:25.2.26.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.27.eng: Monks, you should proclaim from monastery to monastery

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.28.eng: that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:25.2.29.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.4.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.6.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.6.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.7.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.7.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.8.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.8.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.9.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.9.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.10.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.11.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.11.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.12.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.12.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.13.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.13.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.14.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.14.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.15.pli: āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.15.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.17.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.19.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.19.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.20.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.21.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.22.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.22.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.23.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.23.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.24.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.24.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.25.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.25.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.26.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.26.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.27.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.27.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.28.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.28.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.29.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.29.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.30.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.30.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.31.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.31.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.32.pli: āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.32.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.33.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.34.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.35.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.35.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.35.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.36.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.36.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.37.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.38.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.39.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.40.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.40.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.41.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.41.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.42.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.43.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.43.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.44.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.44.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.45.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.46.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.46.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.47.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.47.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.48.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.48.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.49.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.50.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.51.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.51.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.52.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.52.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.53.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.54.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.54.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.55.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:26.1.55.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.56.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:26.1.57.eng: The group of six on wishing in regard to a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.1.pli: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:27.1.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.3.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.5.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.6.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.7.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.8.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:27.1.8.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.9.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.10.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.12.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.13.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.14.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.15.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.16.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.17.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.18.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.19.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.20.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.21.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.22.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.23.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.24.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.25.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.26.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.27.eng: He shouldn’t cause division between monks.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.29.eng: He shouldn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.30.eng: He shouldn’t associate with the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.32.eng: He should train in the monks’ training.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.33.pli: Na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vatthabbaṃ,
pli-tv-kd11:27.1.33.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.34.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.35.pli: na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vatthabbaṃ,
pli-tv-kd11:27.1.35.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.36.eng: He should get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.37.pli: na pakatatto bhikkhu āsādetabbo anto vā bahi vā.
pli-tv-kd11:27.1.37.eng: He shouldn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.38.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.39.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.40.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.41.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.42.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.43.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.44.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.45.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:27.1.46.eng: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.2.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.3.pli: So saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato tamhā āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.3.eng: He then left that monastery and went to another one.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.4.pli: Tattha bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.4.eng: The monks there did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.5.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.5.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.6.pli: Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.6.eng: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.7.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.7.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.8.pli: Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.8.eng: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.9.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato punadeva kosambiṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.9.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and returned to Kosambī.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.10.pli: So sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.10.eng: He then conducted himself properly and suitably, and deserved to be released. He went to the monks

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.11.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.13.eng: The monks told the Buddha. He had the monks gathered and said,

pli-tv-kd11:28.1.14.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:28.1.14.eng: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.”

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.0.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense;

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.8.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.8.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.9.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ, paccuṭṭhānaṃ, añjalikammaṃ, sāmīcikammaṃ, āsanābhihāraṃ sādiyati—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.9.eng: he consents to a regular monk bowing down to him; he consents to a regular monk standing up for him; he consents to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he consents to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him; he consents to a regular monk offering him a seat.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.11.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.11.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.12.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ, pādakathalikaṃ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṃ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṃ sādiyati—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.12.eng: he consents to a regular monk offering him a bed; he consents to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he consents to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he consents to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he consents to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.13.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.14.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.14.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.15.pli: Pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, bhikkhuṃ bhikkhūhi bhedeti—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.15.eng: he charges a regular monk with failure in morality; he charges a regular monk with failure in conduct; he charges a regular monk with failure in view; he charges a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he causes division between monks.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.17.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.17.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.18.pli: Gihiddhajaṃ dhāreti, titthiyaddhajaṃ dhāreti, titthiye sevati;
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.18.eng: he wears lay clothes; he wears the robes of the monastics of other religions; he associates with the monastics of other religions;

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.19.pli: bhikkhū na sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya na sikkhati—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.19.eng: he doesn’t associate with monks; he doesn’t train in the monks’ training.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.20.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.21.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.21.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.22.pli: Pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, ekacchanne anāvāse vasati, ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati;
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.22.eng: he stays in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk;

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.23.pli: pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ disvā āsanā na vuṭṭhāti;
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.23.eng: he doesn’t get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk;

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.24.pli: pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.24.eng: he dismisses a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.25.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.26.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.26.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.27.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:28.2.27.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.28.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:28.2.29.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.0.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.2.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.2.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.5.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense;

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.6.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.6.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.8.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.8.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.9.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ, paccuṭṭhānaṃ, añjalikammaṃ, sāmīcikammaṃ, āsanābhihāraṃ sādiyati—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.9.eng: he doesn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.10.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.11.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.11.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.12.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ, pādakathalikaṃ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṃ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṃ sādiyati—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.12.eng: he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.13.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.14.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.14.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.15.pli: Na pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na bhikkhuṃ bhikkhūhi bhedeti—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.15.eng: he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he doesn’t cause division between monks.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.17.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.17.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.18.pli: Na gihiddhajaṃ dhāreti, na titthiyaddhajaṃ dhāreti, na titthiye sevati, bhikkhū sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya sikkhati—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.18.eng: he doesn’t wear lay clothes; he doesn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions; he doesn’t associate with the monastics of other religions; he associates with monks; he trains in the monks’ training.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.19.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.20.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.20.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.21.pli: Na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, na ekacchanne anāvāse vasati, na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati, pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ disvā āsanā vuṭṭhāti, na pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.21.eng: he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk; he gets up from his seat when he sees a regular monk; he doesn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.22.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.23.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.23.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.24.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:29.1.24.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.25.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:29.1.26.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.1.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, channena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.2.eng: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not recognizing an offense. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.8.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.8.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.12.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.12.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.13.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.13.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.14.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.14.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.15.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.16.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.17.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.18.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.19.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.19.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.20.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.20.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.21.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.21.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.22.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.23.pli: Paṭippassaddhaṃ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā adassane, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.23.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.24.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:30.1.24.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:30.1.25.eng: The fifth section on the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.0.eng: 6. The legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.2.eng: At this time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to make amends for it.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṃ paṭikātun”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.4.eng: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but refuse to make amends for it?”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātun”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchissati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.11.eng: How can Channa commit an offense, but refuse to make amends for it?

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.14.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.15.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.15.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.16.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.17.eng: And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.18.pli: paṭhamaṃ channo bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.18.eng: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.19.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.20.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.20.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.21.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.21.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.22.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.24.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.25.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.25.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.26.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.26.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.27.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.28.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.28.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.30.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.31.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.32.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.33.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.34.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpajjitvā na icchati āpattiṃ paṭikātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.34.eng: This monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.35.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.35.eng: The Sangha is doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.36.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.37.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.37.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.39.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.40.pli: Kataṃ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.40.eng: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.41.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.42.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.42.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.43.eng: Monks, you should proclaim from monastery to monastery

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.44.eng: that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.45.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.46.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.46.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.46.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.47.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.47.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.48.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.49.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.49.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.50.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.50.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.51.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.51.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.52.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.52.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.53.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.53.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.54.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.54.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.55.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.55.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
