pli-tv-kd11:31.1.56.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.56.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.57.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.57.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.58.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.58.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.59.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.59.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.60.pli: āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.60.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.61.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.62.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.63.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.63.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.63.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.64.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.64.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.65.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.66.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.66.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.67.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.67.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.68.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.68.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.69.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.69.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.70.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.70.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.71.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.71.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.72.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.72.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.73.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.73.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.74.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.74.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.75.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.75.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.76.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.76.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.77.pli: āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.77.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.78.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.79.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.80.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.80.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.80.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.81.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.81.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.82.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.83.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.84.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.85.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.85.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.86.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.86.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.87.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.88.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.88.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.89.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.89.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.90.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.91.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.91.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.92.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.92.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.93.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.93.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.94.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.95.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.96.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.96.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.97.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.97.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.98.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.99.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.99.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.100.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.100.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.101.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.102.eng: The group of six on wishing in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.103.1.pli: Āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.103.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.105.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.107.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.108.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.109.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.110.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.110.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.111.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.112.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.114.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.115.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.116.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.117.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.118.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.119.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.120.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.121.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.122.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.123.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.124.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.125.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.126.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.127.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.128.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.129.eng: He shouldn’t cause division between monks.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.131.eng: He shouldn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.132.eng: He shouldn’t associate with the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.134.eng: He should train in the monks’ training.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.135.pli: Na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vatthabbaṃ,
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.135.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.136.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.137.pli: na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vatthabbaṃ,
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.137.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.138.eng: He should get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.139.pli: na pakatatto bhikkhu āsādetabbo anto vā bahi vā.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.139.eng: He shouldn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.140.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.141.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.142.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.143.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.144.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.145.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.146.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.147.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.148.eng: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.149.pli: Atha kho saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.149.eng: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.150.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.151.pli: So saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato tamhā āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.151.eng: He then left that monastery and went to another one.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.152.pli: Tattha bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.152.eng: The monks there did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.153.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.153.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.154.pli: Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.154.eng: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.155.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato tamhāpi āvāsā aññaṃ āvāsaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.155.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.156.pli: Tatthapi bhikkhū neva abhivādesuṃ, na paccuṭṭhesuṃ, na añjalikammaṃ na sāmīcikammaṃ akaṃsu, na sakkariṃsu, na garuṃ kariṃsu, na mānesuṃ, na pūjesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.156.eng: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, or esteem him.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.157.pli: So bhikkhūhi asakkariyamāno agarukariyamāno amāniyamāno apūjiyamāno asakkārapakato punadeva kosambiṃ paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.157.eng: Because of this, he left that monastery too and returned to Kosambī.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.158.pli: So sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.158.eng: He then conducted himself properly and suitably, and deserved to be released. He went to the monks

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.159.pli: “ahaṃ, āvuso, saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.162.pli: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.162.eng: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.163.0.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.163.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.163.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.164.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.164.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.165.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.166.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.166.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.167.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.167.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.168.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.169.pli: pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ, paccuṭṭhānaṃ, añjalikammaṃ, sāmīcikammaṃ, āsanābhihāraṃ sādiyati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.169.eng: he consents to a regular monk bowing down to him; he consents to a regular monk standing up for him; he consents to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he consents to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him; he consents to a regular monk offering him a seat. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.170.pli: pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ, pādakathalikaṃ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṃ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṃ sādiyati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.170.eng: he consents to a regular monk offering him a bed; he consents to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he consents to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he consents to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he consents to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.171.pli: pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, bhikkhuṃ bhikkhūhi bhedeti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.171.eng: he charges a regular monk with failure in morality; he charges a regular monk with failure in conduct; he charges a regular monk with failure in view; he charges a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he causes division between monks. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.172.pli: gihiddhajaṃ dhāreti, titthiyaddhajaṃ dhāreti, titthiye sevati, bhikkhū na sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya na sikkhati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.172.eng: he wears lay clothes; he wears the robes of the monastics of other religions; he associates with the monastics of other religions; he doesn’t associate with monks; he doesn’t train in the monks’ training. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.173.pli: pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, ekacchanne anāvāse vasati, ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati, pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ disvā āsanā na vuṭṭhāti, pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.173.eng: he stays in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk; he dismisses a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.174.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.175.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.175.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.176.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.176.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.177.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.178.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.179.0.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.179.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.179.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.180.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.180.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.181.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.182.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.182.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.183.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.183.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense;

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.184.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.184.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.185.pli: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ, paccuṭṭhānaṃ, añjalikammaṃ, sāmīcikammaṃ, āsanābhihāraṃ sādiyati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.185.eng: he doesn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk doing acts of respect toward him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.186.pli: na pakatattassa bhikkhuno seyyābhihāraṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ, pādakathalikaṃ, pattacīvarappaṭiggahaṇaṃ, nahāne piṭṭhiparikammaṃ sādiyati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.186.eng: he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.187.pli: na pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na ācāravipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na diṭṭhivipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na ājīvavipattiyā anuddhaṃseti, na bhikkhuṃ bhikkhūhi bhedeti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.187.eng: he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he doesn’t cause division between monks. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.188.pli: na gihiddhajaṃ dhāreti, na titthiyaddhajaṃ dhāreti, na titthiye sevati, bhikkhū sevati, bhikkhusikkhāya sikkhati …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.188.eng: he doesn’t wear lay clothes; he doesn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions; he doesn’t associate with the monastics of other religions; he associates with monks; he trains in the monks’ training. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.189.pli: na pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchanne āvāse vasati, na ekacchanne anāvāse vasati, na ekacchanne āvāse vā anāvāse vā vasati, pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ disvā āsanā vuṭṭhāti, na pakatattaṃ bhikkhuṃ āsādeti anto vā bahi vā—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.189.eng: he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk; he gets up from his seat when he sees a regular monk; he doesn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.190.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.191.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.191.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.192.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.192.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.193.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.194.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.195.eng: “And this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.196.pli: Tena bhikkhave, channena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.196.eng: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.197.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.197.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not making amends for an offense. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.198.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.200.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.201.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.202.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.202.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.203.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.203.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.205.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.206.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.206.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.207.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.207.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.208.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.208.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.209.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.210.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.211.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.212.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.213.pli: Ayaṃ channo bhikkhu saṅghena, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.213.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.214.pli: Saṅgho channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.214.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.215.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.215.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.216.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.217.pli: Paṭippassaddhaṃ saṅghena channassa bhikkhuno, āpattiyā appaṭikamme, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.217.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.218.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:31.1.218.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:31.1.219.eng: The sixth section on the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.0.eng: 7. The legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ariṭṭhassa nāma bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.2.eng: At that time the monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, had the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.3.pli: “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.3.eng: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho sambahulā bhikkhū ariṭṭhassa nāma kira bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.4.eng: A number of monks heard that Ariṭṭha had that view.

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.5.pli: “Tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū yena ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira te, āvuso ariṭṭha, evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.8.eng: “Is it true, Ariṭṭha, that you have such a view?”

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.9.pli: tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti?

pli-tv-kd11:32.1.10.pli: “Evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.1.10.eng: “Yes, indeed. As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.3.eng: for it’s not good to misrepresent him.

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.4.eng: The Buddha would never say such a thing.

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.5.pli: Anekapariyāyenāvuso ariṭṭha, antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā bhagavatā.
pli-tv-kd11:32.2.5.eng: The Buddha has given many discourses about the obstacles being obstructive

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.6.eng: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.7.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-kd11:32.2.7.eng: The Buddha has said that the enjoyment provided by worldly pleasures is small, whereas the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.8.pli: Aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-kd11:32.2.8.eng: The Buddha has said that worldly pleasures are similar to a skeleton,

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.9.eng: similar to a piece of meat,

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.11.eng: similar to a pit of coals,

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.14.eng: similar to fruits on a tree,

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.15.eng: similar to a knife and chopping block,

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.17.pli: sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.2.17.eng: and similar to a snake’s head. The suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.18.pli: Evampi kho ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tehi bhikkhūhi vuccamāno tatheva taṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati—
pli-tv-kd11:32.2.18.eng: But even though the monks corrected Ariṭṭha in this way, he stubbornly held on to that bad and erroneous view, and continued to insist on it.

pli-tv-kd11:32.2.19.pli: “evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.1.pli: Yato ca kho te bhikkhū nāsakkhiṃsu ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ, atha kho te bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.1.eng: And since they were unable to make him give up that view, they went to the Buddha and told him what had happened.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.2.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Ariṭṭha:

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.3.pli: “saccaṃ kira te, ariṭṭha, evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.3.eng: “Is it true, Ariṭṭha, that you have a bad and erroneous view such as this:

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.4.pli: tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.4.eng: ‘As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them’?”

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.5.pli: “Evaṃ byā kho ahaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.6.pli: “Kassa nu kho nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mayā evaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāsi?
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.6.eng: “Foolish man, who do you think I’ve taught like this?

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.7.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena antarāyikā dhammā antarāyikā vuttā?
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.7.eng: Haven’t I given many discourses about the obstacles being obstructive

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.8.eng: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them?

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.9.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā mayā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.9.eng: I’ve said that the enjoyment provided by worldly pleasures is small, whereas the suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.10.pli: Aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā kāmā vuttā mayā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.10.eng: I’ve said that worldly pleasures are similar to a skeleton,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.11.eng: similar to a piece of meat,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.13.eng: similar to a pit of coals,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.16.eng: similar to fruits on a tree,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.17.eng: similar to a knife and chopping block,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.19.pli: sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā mayā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.19.eng: and similar to a snake’s head. The suffering and trouble with them are huge, and so their drawbacks are greater.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.20.pli: Atha ca pana tvaṃ, moghapurisa, attanā duggahitena amhe ceva abbhācikkhasi, attānañca khaṇasi, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavasi.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.20.eng: And yet by misunderstanding, you have misrepresented me, hurt yourself, and made much demerit.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.21.pli: Tañhi te, moghapurisa, bhavissati dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.21.eng: This will be for your long-lasting harm and suffering.

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.22.eng: And this will affect people’s confidence …”

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.24.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.25.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karotu—
pli-tv-kd11:32.3.25.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.3.26.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.1.eng: And this is how it should be done.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.2.pli: paṭhamaṃ ariṭṭho bhikkhu codetabbo, codetvā sāretabbo, sāretvā āpattiṃ āropetabbo, āpattiṃ āropetvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.2.eng: First you should accuse the monk Ariṭṭha. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he’s charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.4.pli: Ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.4.eng: The monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.5.pli: tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyāti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.5.eng: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.6.eng: He’s not giving up that view.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.8.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.10.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.11.pli: Ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.11.eng: The monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.12.pli: tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyāti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.12.eng: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.13.eng: He’s not giving up that view.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.14.pli: Saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.14.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.15.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.16.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.18.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.19.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.20.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.21.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.22.pli: Ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa evarūpaṃ pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppannaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.22.eng: The monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.23.pli: tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā yeme antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyāti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.23.eng: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstacles are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.24.eng: He’s not giving up that view.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.25.pli: Saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.25.eng: The Sangha does a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.26.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.27.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa karaṇaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.27.eng: Any monk who approves of doing this legal procedure

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.29.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.30.pli: Kataṃ saṅghena ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.30.eng: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.31.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.32.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.32.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.33.eng: Monks, you should proclaim from monastery to monastery

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.34.pli: ‘ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo, saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato—
pli-tv-kd11:32.4.34.eng: that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:32.4.35.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.0.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.2.pli: Asammukhā kataṃ hoti, appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.2.eng: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.4.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.5.pli: Anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.5.eng: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.6.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, asāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.6.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.7.pli: asammukhā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.7.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.8.pli: appaṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.8.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.9.pli: appaṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.9.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.10.pli: anāpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.10.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.11.pli: adesanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.11.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.12.pli: desitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.12.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.13.pli: acodetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.13.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.14.pli: asāretvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.14.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.15.pli: āpattiṃ anāropetvā kataṃ hoti, adhammena kataṃ hoti, vaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.15.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.16.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ adhammakammañca hoti, avinayakammañca, duvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.17.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme adhammakammadvādasakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.17.eng: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.18.0.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.18.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.18.1.eng: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.19.pli: Sammukhā kataṃ hoti, paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.19.eng: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.20.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.21.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.21.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.22.pli: Āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.22.eng: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.23.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, sāretvā kataṃ hoti, āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.23.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.24.pli: sammukhā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.24.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.25.pli: paṭipucchā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.25.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.26.pli: paṭiññāya kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.26.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.27.pli: āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.27.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.28.pli: desanāgāminiyā āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.28.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.29.pli: adesitāya āpattiyā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.29.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.30.pli: codetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.30.eng: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.31.pli: sāretvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.31.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.32.pli: āpattiṃ āropetvā kataṃ hoti, dhammena kataṃ hoti, samaggena kataṃ hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.32.eng: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after charging the person with their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.”

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.33.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgataṃ, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ dhammakammañca hoti, vinayakammañca, suvūpasantañca.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.34.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme dhammakammadvādasakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.34.eng: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.0.eng: The group of six on wishing

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.1.eng: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.36.pli: Bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.36.eng: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.37.eng: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.38.eng: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.39.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.40.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.40.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.41.pli: Adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.41.eng: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.42.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.43.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.43.eng: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.44.pli: Buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.44.eng: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.45.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.46.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.46.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.47.pli: Eko bhaṇḍanakārako hoti kalahakārako vivādakārako bhassakārako saṅghe adhikaraṇakārako;
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.47.eng: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.48.pli: eko bālo hoti abyatto āpattibahulo anapadāno;
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.48.eng: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries;

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.49.eng: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.50.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.51.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.51.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.52.pli: Eko adhisīle sīlavipanno hoti, eko ajjhācāre ācāravipanno hoti, eko atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno hoti—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.52.eng: those who’ve failed in the higher morality; those who’ve failed in conduct; those who’ve failed in view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.53.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.54.pli: Aparesampi, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.54.eng: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three other kinds of monks:

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.55.pli: Eko buddhassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko dhammassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, eko saṅghassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsati—
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.55.eng: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.56.pli: imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kareyya.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.57.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage ukkhepanīyakamme ākaṅkhamānachakkaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.57.eng: The group of six on wishing in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.58.1.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammakatena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sammā vattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.58.1.eng: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.60.eng: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.62.eng: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.63.eng: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.64.eng: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.65.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti sā āpatti na āpajjitabbā,
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.65.eng: He shouldn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.66.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.67.eng: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.1.eng: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.2.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.3.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.4.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.5.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk doing appropriate duties for him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.6.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.7.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.8.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.9.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot-scraper.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.10.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.11.eng: He shouldn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.12.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.13.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.14.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.15.eng: He shouldn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.16.eng: He shouldn’t cause division between monks.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.18.eng: He shouldn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.19.eng: He shouldn’t associate with the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.21.eng: He should train in the monks’ training.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.22.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.23.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.24.eng: He shouldn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.25.eng: He should get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.26.eng: He shouldn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.70.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.71.eng: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.72.eng: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.73.eng: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.74.eng: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.75.eng: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.76.eng: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.77.eng: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:33.1.78.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme tecattālīsavattaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:33.1.78.eng: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.1.pli: Atha kho saṅgho ariṭṭhassa bhikkhuno gaddhabādhipubbassa, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ akāsi—
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.2.eng: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.3.pli: So saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhami.

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamissatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.5.eng: “How could the monk Ariṭṭha disrobe after the Sangha had done a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?”

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamatī”ti?
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Ariṭṭha disrobed after the Sangha had done a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?”

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma so, bhikkhave, moghapuriso saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato vibbhamissati?
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.12.eng: How can that foolish man disrobe after the Sangha has done a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view?

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.15.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd11:34.1.16.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetu.
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.16.eng: “Well then, the Sangha should lift that legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view.”
pli-tv-kd11:34.1.16.comm: All versions of the Pali available to me have this reading, which presumably is wrong. The expected reading is that the saṅghakamma should not be lifted. Ariṭṭha has returned to lay life. To lift the saṅghakamma done against him would only be possible if he were still a monk. Moreover, even if he were a monk, he would have to give up his view before the saṅghakamma could be lifted. Perhaps this should be understood as a general teaching, not directly related to Ariṭṭha.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.0.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.2.pli: Upasampādeti, nissayaṃ deti, sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.2.eng: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.3.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissage, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.4.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.4.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.5.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.5.eng: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.6.eng: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. …

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ …

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.8.eng: he consents to a regular monk bowing down to him; he consents to a regular monk standing up for him; he consents to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he consents to a regular monk doing appropriate duties for him; he consents to a regular monk offering him a seat. … he consents to a regular monk offering him a bed; he consents to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he consents to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he consents to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he consents to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing. … he charges a regular monk with failure in morality; he charges a regular monk with failure in conduct; he charges a regular monk with failure in view; he charges a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he causes division between monks. … he wears lay clothes; he wears the robes of the monastics of other religions; he associates with the monastics of other religions; he doesn’t associate with monks; he doesn’t train in the monks’ training. … he stays in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk; he dismisses a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.9.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.9.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view shouldn’t be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.10.pli: Pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, savacanīyaṃ karoti, anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, okāsaṃ kāreti, codeti, sāreti, bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.10.eng: he cancels the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he directs a regular monk; he gives instructions to a regular monk; he gets permission from a regular monk to correct him; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.11.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ nappaṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.12.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme nappaṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.12.eng: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.13.0.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.13.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.13.1.eng: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.14.pli: Na upasampādeti, na nissayaṃ deti, na sāmaṇeraṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, na bhikkhunovādakasammutiṃ sādiyati, sammatopi bhikkhuniyo na ovadati—
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.14.eng: he doesn’t give the full ordination; he doesn’t give formal support; he doesn’t have a novice monk attend on him; he doesn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he doesn’t instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.15.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.16.pli: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.16.eng: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:
