pli-tv-kd11:34.2.17.pli: Yāya āpattiyā saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ kataṃ hoti taṃ āpattiṃ na āpajjati, aññaṃ vā tādisikaṃ, tato vā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ;
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.17.eng: he doesn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.18.pli: kammaṃ na garahati, kammike na garahati—
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.18.eng: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure. …

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.19.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ …

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.20.eng: he doesn’t consent to a regular monk bowing down to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk standing up for him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk raising his joined palms to him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk doing appropriate duties for him; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a seat. … he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a bed; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot stool; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk offering him a foot scraper; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he doesn’t consent to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing. … he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in morality; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in conduct; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in view; he doesn’t charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he doesn’t cause division between monks. … he doesn’t wear lay clothes; he doesn’t wear the robes of the monastics of other religions; he doesn’t associate with the monastics of other religions; he associates with monks; he trains in the monks’ training. … he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he doesn’t stay in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk; he gets up from his seat when he sees a regular monk; he doesn’t dismiss a regular monk, whether indoors or outdoors.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.21.pli: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.21.eng: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view should be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.22.pli: Na pakatattassa bhikkhuno uposathaṃ ṭhapeti, na pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, na savacanīyaṃ karoti, na anuvādaṃ paṭṭhapeti, na okāsaṃ kāreti, na codeti, na sāreti, na bhikkhūhi sampayojeti—
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.22.eng: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk; he doesn’t direct a regular monk; he doesn’t give instructions to a regular monk; he doesn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.23.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambhetabbaṃ.

pli-tv-kd11:34.2.24.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakamme paṭippassambhetabbatecattālīsakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:34.2.24.eng: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.1.eng: “And, monks, this is how it should be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakatena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.2.eng: The monk who’s been ejected by the Sangha for not giving up a bad view should approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, bhante, saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattāmi, lomaṃ pātemi, netthāraṃ vattāmi, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.3.eng: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not giving up a bad view. I’m now conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask for that legal procedure to be lifted.’

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.4.eng: And he should ask a second

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.6.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.7.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.8.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.8.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting monk so-and-so for not giving up a bad view. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheyya.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should lift that legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.11.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.12.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.12.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting monk so-and-so for not giving up a bad view. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.13.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.13.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.14.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.14.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.15.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.16.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.17.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.18.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.19.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghena, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammakato sammā vattati, lomaṃ pāteti, netthāraṃ vattati, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.19.eng: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting monk so-and-so for not giving up a bad view. He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking for that legal procedure to be lifted.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.20.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paṭippassambheti.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.20.eng: The Sangha lifts that legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.21.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyassa kammassa paṭippassaddhi, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.21.eng: Any monk who approves of lifting that legal procedure should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.22.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.23.pli: Paṭippassaddhaṃ saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno, pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge, ukkhepanīyakammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.23.eng: The Sangha has lifted that legal procedure of ejecting monk so-and-so for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.24.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.24.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.25.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhepanīyakammaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ sattamaṃ.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.25.eng: The seventh section on the legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.

pli-tv-kd11:35.1.26.pli: Kammakkhandhako paṭhamo. Imamhi khandhake vatthū satta.
pli-tv-kd11:35.1.26.eng: The first chapter on legal procedures is finished. In this chapter there are seven topics.
